other_tests.findings: Small locules of free air seen tracking along the anterior abdominal cavity as well as into the retroperitoneum. Diverticulosis is present along the sigmoid colon with marked wall edema and surrounding inflammatory fat stranding. A loculated area of hypodensity with peripheral enhancement measuring approximately 1.9 x 2.7 suggests intramural abscess. Multiple adjacent locules of extraluminal gas are present, the largest of which measures 2 x 2.5 cm. Foci of free intraperitoneal air seen scattered throughout the abdomen and below the diaphragm. Adjacent to this inflammation in the lower left pelvis is a 20 x 14-mm collection of fluid that could represent a developing abscess.
